input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: InfobloxNIOS.

This wrapper will release all the ip addresses from given network or release specific ip addresses which is provided as input from given network.
Release address means moving status of ip address from 'used' to 'unused'.
Sample items Xml:
<items> <item> <target> <host>localhost</host> <user-name>admin</user-name> <password encryption-type="Base64">YWRtaW4=</password> <timeout-secs>120</timeout-secs> </target> <parameters> <network>10.0.0.0</network> <mask>24</mask> <network-view>default</network-view> <ip-address>10.0.0.3</ip-address> </parameters> </item> </items>
Elements' Description:
target[Conditional]:
This tag can contain a dynamic target configuration. Following tags are applicable while defining a dynamic target.
host[Conditional]: Host name or IP address of Infoblox Grid Manager. This tag is required while providing dynamic targets.
user-name[Conditional]: Username required to connect Infoblox Grid Manager. This tag is required while providing dynamic targets.
password[Conditional]: The password associated with the <user-name> provided. Encrypted password can be provided by providing an "encryption-type" attribute. This tag is required while providing dynamic targets. Valid values for encryption-type are: Plain, Base64 Default value: Plain
timeout-secs[Optional] Specifies the time, in seconds, after which the attempt to connect to the Infoblox Grid Manager fails. Default value in seconds: 60
Note: If no adapter configurations are specified while configuring the adapter dynamic target need to be defined under "target" tag.
network[required] Specify the network or subnetwork.
mask[required] Specify the mask for the network. Must be used with network parameter.
network-view[Optional] Specify the network view in which the network is located. By default, the system-defined default network view are searched
ip-address[Conditional] if ip-address is provided then only specified ip-address will released else all the addresses from given network will be released.

output.description: Returned adapter response is captured in this context parameter.
